  • There have been multiple missed deadlines since its initial announcement in 2022.

title: What time is SpaceX's Starship Flight 7 launch test on Jan. 15? - Space.com
summary:
What time is SpaceX's Starship Flight 7 launch test on Jan. 15?

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Space.com

SpaceX is preparing for the launch of its Starship Flight 7 on January 15, 2025. This launch will test a new version of the world's largest rocket with significant upgrades.

  • The launch is scheduled for 5 p.m. EST (2200 GMT) from the Starbase facility in South Texas.
  • SpaceX is targeting to catch the Super Heavy booster at the launch site, similar to a previous successful attempt.
  • Viewers can watch the launch live on Space.com and other platforms starting 30 minutes before launch.
  • If the weather or technical issues prevent the launch, backup days are available for January 14 and 15.
"Excitement Guaranteed," says SpaceX regarding the launch.

The upcoming Starship Flight 7 is pivotal as it showcases advancements in technology and aims for new records in space exploration.
newTitle: SpaceX's Starship Flight 7 Launch Set for January 15, 2025

  • Apple Intelligence is now available on iPhones, iPads, and Macs.
  • About 75% of iPhone users find little value in Apple Intelligence.
  • The intelligence features take up approximately 7GB of local storage.
  • Users can disable specific features easily through Settings.

"If you really don’t want anything to do with Apple Intelligence, and you’ve already enabled it, you can turn it off completely."

title: NCLT Hearing Hack: A Wake-Up Call to Bolster Courts' Cybersecurity | Today News - Mint
summary:
NCLT Hearing Hack: A Wake-Up Call to Bolster Courts' Cybersecurity

Published on: December 2023 | Source: Today News

The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) in Mumbai has temporarily suspended virtual hearings, requiring lawyers to appear physically after its virtual hearing system was hacked on 12 and 17 December.

  • Unidentified hackers disrupted proceedings by broadcasting pornographic content.
  • Legal and cyber law experts warn about the vulnerability of Indian courts to such cyberattacks.
  • There is a growing consensus on the need to strengthen digital infrastructure to ensure accessible justice.
"This incident highlights the critical need for enhanced cybersecurity measures in our legal system." - Cyber Law Expert

In conclusion, the recent hack of the NCLT's virtual hearing system serves as a significant reminder of the vulnerabilities present in digital court systems and the urgent need for improved cybersecurity measures to protect the integrity of judicial proceedings.
newTitle: NCLT Hearing Hack: A Wake-Up Call to Bolster Courts' Cybersecurity

title: Many iPhone, Android users in India report post-update issues: Survey - NewsBytes
summary:
Survey Reveals Post-Update Issues Among iPhone and Android Users in India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NewsBytes

A new survey by LocalCircles highlights that a significant number of iPhone and Android users in India are facing service disruptions after recent software updates.

  • 60% of iPhone users and 40% of Android users reported issues post-update.
  • Common problems for iPhone users include call failures and app hanging.
  • Among iPhone users, 28% reported voice call connectivity issues.
  • The survey, conducted from November 12 to December 26, gathered over 47,000 responses.
Nearly nine out of every 10 iPhone users blamed the software update for issues over their Wi-Fi or mobile network.

In response to user complaints, Apple has been providing updates to address the issues encountered after software installations.
newTitle: Survey Reveals Post-Update Issues Among iPhone and Android Users in India

  • iPhone users face call failures; Android users report app freezing.
  • The survey received over 47,000 responses from users across 322 districts in India.

"6 in 10 apple iPhone users surveyed who have upgraded to iOS 18 or higher are having difficulties. 28 per cent of the respondents stated that most/some of voice and OTT calls don't connect or drop."

title: Redmi Watch 5 in for review - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
What is PIA's MACE feature - TechRadar
summary:
What is PIA's MACE feature

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: TechRadar

The article explores MACE, a built-in ad blocker feature from Private Internet Access (PIA). MACE operates at the DNS level, blocking ads, trackers, and malware before they reach your device, providing enhanced privacy and resource efficiency.

  • MACE is an integrated ad, tracker, and malware blocker from PIA.
  • It operates at the DNS level, blocking unwanted content proactively.
  • The feature is beneficial for privacy, reducing ads, and protecting against malware.
  • MACE is available on most PIA client apps, except for Android due to Google’s restrictions.
  • Enabling MACE is a straightforward process within the PIA app settings.

Remember, MACE isn’t a comprehensive malware solution on its own and can’t replace an anti-virus engine.

MACE is a valuable addition to your security toolkit, working alongside other ad-blocking solutions, though it has limitations regarding its static blocklist and malware detection capabilities.
newTitle: Understanding PIA's MACE Feature: An Advanced Ad Blocker
